docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: WITH HIS MOP OF black hair and his brown ankle-high boots, Dr. Etienne-Emile Baulieu comes across at once as a different kind of scientist. His breezy, almost brash manner and hyperkinetic nature give him the air more of a populist politician than of a meticulous medical researcher, an expert in hormones at France's National Institute of Health and Medical

headline.main: A NEW PILL, A FIERCE BATTLE

docs.snippet: LEAD: WITH HIS MOP OF black hair and his brown ankle-high boots, Dr. Etienne-Emile Baulieu comes across at once as a different kind of scientist. His breezy, almost brash manner and hyperkinetic nature give him the air more of a populist politician...

byline.original: By Steven Greenhouse; Steven Greenhouse is a reporter for The New York Times based in Paris
